page.title: 14History of Carlton Towers
page.content: The Carlton Estate has been passed down entirely by inheritance since the Norman Conquest.In 1O86 it was held by Robert de Brus. In 1301 it was inherited by Nicolas Stapleton and wife Sibyl de Bellow.His son Miles had two sons,Nicholas who inherited Carlton,and Gilbert.He had two sons,Sir Miles and Brian,who inherited the crest.From him Carlton passed to Brian,his grandson,who married Joan,neice and co-heiress of the last Viscount Beaumont.In 1476 they were the first of the family to live there.This made the Stapletons heirs to the Barony of Beaumont.The Beaumonts live there to this date. The present owner is the Duke of Norfolk,who inherited it from his mother,the last Baroness Beaumont,who is buried in the local cemetery.
